summary: Rename project to "QUICK-D" (from "Quick-Delvery") and update branding/logo accordingly, while continuing to build a production-ready, scalable quick-commerce platform (mobile app + backend API + admin panel) with the existing planned feature set.
architectural_notes: Microservices-ready, scalable architecture with clean separation between mobile app, backend API, and admin panel.

Tech stack: React Native (TypeScript, Redux Toolkit, React Navigation, Axios, Lottie); Backend Node/Express (TypeScript, MVC, middleware-based error handling); MongoDB/Mongoose; Admin React (Vite) + Tailwind + Chart.js.
Security requirements: JWT + refresh tokens, RBAC, bcrypt password hashing, Helmet, rate limiting, CORS, input validation, sanitization.
Location gating: enforce 15km delivery radius using Haversine formula against warehouse/store coordinates.
DevOps readiness: Docker, environment-based config, free-tier friendly deployment targets (Render/Railway) and production build instructions.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Combined QUICK-D logo mark on transparent background (quick-d-combined-logo.dim_512x512.png)

existing_features.title: Create the Quick-Delvery frontend as a responsive, mobile-first web app with a premium modern UI: purple + green gradient theme, glassmorphism accents, rounded cards, soft shadows, clean typography, smooth page/screen transitions, skeleton loaders, and consistent empty/error states across all screens.
Implement a Splash / intro experience that shows an animated Quick-Delvery logo and then routes users into authentication or the home screen depending on session state.
Implement authentication using Internet Identity (supported on Internet Computer) and map authenticated principals to user profiles in the backend; include logout in the Profile section.
Implement location capture in the browser: (a) auto-detect GPS via browser geolocation and (b) allow manual location entry as latitude/longitude; persist the user's chosen location in their profile.

Enforce delivery/service availability within a 15km radius of a configurable store/warehouse coordinate using the Haversine formula; outside the radius show: "Quick-Delvery is not available in your area yet" and block checkout/order placement.

Build the Home screen with: category grid (Groceries, Fruits, Vegetables, Dairy, Snacks, Beverages, Personal Care), banner carousel for offers, a debounced search bar with suggestion dropdown, and sections for trending products and recommended products.

Implement product catalog backend and UI: product listing page with pagination/lazy loading, category filtering, and search results; product details page with images, discount badge, stock indicator, and add-to-cart interactions.
Implement a cart system with add/remove items, quantity increase/decrease controls, and an add-to-cart animation; persist cart per user session (and optionally in backend for authenticated users).
Implement coupon and pricing logic: coupon code validation, delivery charge auto-calculation, tax calculation, and a clear total summary (subtotal, discounts, delivery, tax, total).

Create checkout flow with address management (create/list/update/delete addresses) and payment option selection: UPI, Card, Cash on Delivery; implement a payment simulation and create an order on successful confirmation.

Implement order success page and order tracking UI with a timeline of statuses: Order Placed → Packed → Out for Delivery → Delivered; include an ETA countdown/timer and status progression simulation via polling.
Add Order History and Profile sections: list past orders with details, allow editing user profile fields (basic), display saved addresses shortcut, and provide Logout.

Create an Admin Panel within the web frontend with protected admin routes and role-based access control (admin vs user): admin login via Internet Identity principal allowlist, dashboard analytics (total users, total orders, revenue graph), product management (add/edit/delete, image URL), category management, order management (update status), user management, coupon management, and delivery radius configuration.
Add in-app notifications (non-push) for order status updates and offer alerts: backend stores notifications per user; frontend shows a notifications list and unread indicator.
Provide seed data creation tooling via backend methods callable from the admin UI: initial categories, sample products with images, sample banners/offers, and at least one coupon.

Add a project documentation page in the app (or repository docs) containing: local run instructions (dfx), environment/config instructions (store coordinate/radius, admin allowlist), and a deployment guide for Internet Computer canisters.

Expand the seed data so the app includes a larger, realistic initial catalog across these categories: Groceries, Fruits, Vegetables, Dairy, and Snacks (i.e., seed many more products than the current small sample set).
Add first-class product category support in the backend Product model so category filtering works correctly for seeded products and catalog browsing.
Add multiple offer banners and display them in the existing Home banner carousel (more than the current 3), with clear English titles/subtitles for grocery offers.
Add coupon support beyond the current single mock coupon so users can apply multiple coupon codes, and ensure coupons are available/visible to users during cart/checkout.

Rename the app brand from "Quick-Delvery" to "QUICK-D" across the web frontend, updating all user-facing text (page titles, headings, marketing copy where the brand name appears, and footer copyright) so the brand is consistently shown as "QUICK-D".

Replace the current logo used in the app UI with the new combined QUICK-D logo, updating all places that currently render "/assets/generated/quick-delvery-logo.dim_512x512.png" to use the new generated combined logo asset, and ensure alt text uses "QUICK-D".
Add the new combined QUICK-D logo image file to the frontend static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and ensure it is used directly by the frontend (no backend routing for the image).

new_feature_requests.summary: React Native (TypeScript) user mobile app with modern gradient UI, animations, dark mode, and core screens (splash, auth, home, product list/details, cart, checkout, orders, profile)
Authentication system: email/password, mobile OTP (mock), Google OAuth, secure JWT storage, token refresh, logout
Location & delivery radius logic: GPS + manual entry, Haversine distance check, restrict service/orders to within 15km and show unavailable message otherwise
Product discovery: categories, banner carousel, debounced search with suggestions, trending/recommendations, pagination/lazy loading and image optimization
Cart & pricing: add-to-cart, quantity controls, remove items, coupon validation, delivery charge + tax calculation, totals summary
Checkout & addresses: address management, order confirmation/success screens, and payment options (UPI/card/COD) with Razorpay/mock simulation
Orders: create orders, order history, real-time status simulation with timeline (Placed→Packed→Out for Delivery→Delivered) and ETA timer
Push notifications for order status updates and offers, plus loading/skeletons, empty states, and error handling screens
Backend REST API (Node.js + Express + TypeScript) with MVC structure, JWT auth, RBAC, bcrypt hashing, validation/sanitization, global error handling
MongoDB schema design (Users, Products, Categories, Orders, Coupons, Admin, Addresses, Notifications, Payments) with indexing, timestamps, and status enums; include seed data
Admin panel (React + Vite + Tailwind + Chart.js): secure admin login, dashboard analytics, manage products/categories/orders/users/coupons, configure delivery radius, image upload
DevOps/production deliverables: Docker support, .env configuration, CI-ready structure, local run + deployment guides (Render/Railway/AWS), production builds, API documentation

Implement backend data models and persistence in Motoko for: Users (principal-mapped), Products, Categories, Orders, Coupons, Addresses, Notifications (in-app), and Payments (simulated); include validation, indexed lookup patterns where applicable, enums for statuses, timestamps, and structured error handling.
Add full initial commerce content: populate categories (Groceries, Fruits, Vegetables, Dairy, Snacks), create offer banners, and create coupons (seeded and available in app/admin)

Branding update: rename app/project to "QUICK-D" across mobile/web/admin/backend and replace the logo with a combined/updated logo (update app icons, splash, headers, and any marketing/admin UI references).
Ensure admin has product access/management capabilities (view/add/edit/delete products) via protected admin routes with RBAC.
